thread.title: ‘I’m just going to call in at the pub’
thread.title_full: ‘I’m just going to call in at the pub’

title: ‘I’m just going to call in at the pub’
text:
Cisco adds cybersecurity to British portfolio Published at 12:01AM, October 5 2015 
The new chief of Cisco has reaffirmed the company’s faith in the British technology industry by swooping for a Watford cybersecurity provider Currying favour with web’s chattering classes Published at 12:01AM, October 5 2015 
The founder and chairman of Cobra Beer will unveil a surprise drive into the technology industry today when he launches a photo-sharing app Higher prices mean Three into O2 won’t go, warn regulators Published at 12:01AM, October 3 2015 
The competition watchdog in Britain says the £10.25bn tie-up between Three and O2 ‘threatens to affect significantly competition in the UK’ Autonomy’s Lynch sues HP for $150m Published at 12:01AM, October 2 2015 
British entrepreneur Mike Lynch has fired back in the brewing legal battle with Hewlett-Packard after suing the US company for $150 million Sponsored Editorial
